channel.title: NPC Transformation Packet
channel.description:
So I've been working on perfecting NPC Transformation , but i'm stumped on one simple thing that some may be able to point out rather easily but I'm currently lost.
Problem: I have the NPC Transforming randomly (which is does fine), but once the NPC Transforms, depending on which it turns into, it is supposed to use a different attack animation/death animation and combat style. Now I have the Animations loaded in it's EmoteHandler, I have the NPC details in NPC.cfg, and I have the different combat styles added in NPCHandler.java, so in theory, it should work fine which it doesn't. The first NPC attacks using Melee (which it is supposed too), but once it turns into a different NPC the emotes/attack style does not change. Any ideas on correcting this error?

item.title: NPC Transformation Packet
item.dc:creator: @MicroZoft MicroZoft
item.description:
@MicroZoft wrote:

Fixed, thanks gentlemen.

Read full topic

item.title: NPC Transformation Packet
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

Oh I thought you were on about transforming a player into an npc.

Well the same applies and pretty sure the answer has been given.

Read full topic

item.title: NPC Transformation Packet
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“MicroZoft, post:7, topic:541877”]Change via ID.

Inside requestTransform you need to do something like npcType = requestedId. Because although you are changing its appearance the server still thinks of it as the old type, and it is using that to get the animations and what not.

Read full topic

item.title: NPC Transformation Packet
item.dc:creator: @MicroZoft MicroZoft
item.description:
@MicroZoft wrote:

Change via ID.

Read full topic

item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

How are you transforming the npc? Are you despawning/respawning the new NPC, or are you using the npc transform update mask.

item.title: NPC Transformation Packet
item.dc:creator: @MicroZoft MicroZoft
item.description:
@MicroZoft wrote:

ohokay:

You’re changing the appearance of the npc, but you’re still sending player animations. You need to modify these anims that are sent to the client.

I’m not messing with the player at all, I’m simply changing the ID of the one NPC into another one. Example: 6002 at half HP -> Tranforms into 7552 (different NPC entirely).

Now if I spawn 7552 and attack the NPC, he loads and uses the proper animations and attack style that I have loaded for him.

But if I TRANSFORM 6002->7552 it doesn’t use the attack animations and style I have loaded for him.

Yes I have all the proper code added for NPC animations, I animate all my bosses it’s just an error I came across-ed when working with NPC Transformations.

Read full topic

item.title: NPC Transformation Packet
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

You’re changing the appearance of the npc, but you’re still sending player animations. You need to modify these anims that are sent to the client.
